Sequence Information.Peptide Name: WAMP-1b (hevein-like peptide, natural AMPs; UCSS1a; plants;chitin-binding, BBS; 5S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Compared to WAMP-1a, WAMP-1b contains one additional Arg at the C-terminus. 10-Cys. MOA: This proteinase of fungi (fungalysin Fv-cmp) cleaves class IV chitinases, plant defense proteins that bind and degrade chitin of fungal cell walls. However, equal molar ratio of plant defensin WAMP-1b or WAMP-2 to chitinase was sufficient to block the fungalysin activity of fungi keeping the plant chitinase intact. Thus, WAMPs represent a novel type of protease inhibitors (enzyme inhibitor) being active against fungal metalloproteases (Slavokhotova etal., 2014). UPdated 8/2014.
Literature Information.Author: Odintsova TI, Vassilevski AA, Slavokhotova AA, Musolyamov AK, Finkina EI, Khadeeva NV, Rogozhin EA, Korostyleva TV, Pukhalsky VA, Grishin EV, Egorov TA.2009
Literature Information.Title: A novel antifungal hevein-type peptide from Triticum kiharae seeds with a unique 10-cysteine motif.
